articles.title: Fed officials downplay virus even as markets see rate cuts
articles.description: When Wall Street expects the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates, should that influence the Fed's decisions
articles.content:
WASHINGTON -- 
When Wall Street expects the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates, should that influence the Fed's decisions?

articles.title: To stop the novel coronavirus from spreading, 'we need to act quickly,' WHO says
articles.description: Hundreds of Chinese inmates have been infected with the novel coronavirus as the outbreak spreads to prisons across China.
articles.content: In a rapid development, Iranian authorities reported 18 cases of novel coronavirus and four deaths over the course of two days, the World Health Organization detailed at a Friday news conference. Lebanon also reported its first coronavirus case Friday, in a t… [+6149 chars]

articles.author: MICHELLE CHAPMAN AP Business Writer
articles.title: Deere sees some stability on farms in bruising trade fight
articles.description: Deere is reporting a surprisingly strong first quarter after an extended period in which the tractor maker was bruised by the ongoing trade war between the United States and China
articles.content:
Deere & Co. had a surprisingly strong first quarter after an extended period in which the tractor and construction equipment maker was bruised by the ongoing trade war between the United States and China.

articles.author: Joohee Cho
articles.title: New cases of coronavirus double in 24 hours in South Korea
articles.description: Cases of coronavirus have doubled in South Korea doubled in 24 hours; most of those infected are followers of the religious sect Shincheonji.
articles.content:
SEOUL, South Korea -- 
South Korea's number of newly confirmed cases of the novel coronavirus has doubled in just 24 hours, to a total of 204 cases. The majority are from the southeastern city of Daegu and are followers of the Shincheonji Church of Jesus, a … [+2761 chars]

articles.author: Patrick Reevell
articles.title: Coronavirus hysteria sparks violent clashes in Ukraine, fueled by disinformation
articles.description: Coronavirus hysteria sparks violent clashes in Ukraine, with protesters attacking buses carrying people evacuated from China and officials warn of disinformation
articles.content:
Hysteria over the novel coronavirus epidemic has sparked violent protests in Ukraine, fueled by panic and disinformation around the outbreak -- even though the country has no confirmed cases of the virus.
Protests and violent clashes with police broke out in… [+5302 chars]

articles.title: College investigating reports of coronavirus-themed party
articles.description: A New York college is investigating whether an off-campus coronavirus-themed party violated the student code of conduct
articles.content:
ALBANY, N.Y. -- 
A New York college is investigating whether an off-campus coronavirus-themed party violated the student code of conduct.

articles.title: Stocks open lower on Wall Street following weakness overseas
articles.description: Stocks are opening lower again on Wall Street, putting the market on track for a weekly loss after two weeks of gains
articles.content:

articles.content:

articles.title: Iran reports 2 more deaths, 13 new cases of new coronavirus
articles.description: Iran is reporting two more deaths from the new virus that emerged in China and says the fatalities were from among 13 new confirmed cases of the virus in Iran
articles.content:

Iran is reporting two more deaths from the new virus that emerged in China and says the fatalities were from among 13 new confirmed cases of the virus in Iran.

articles.title: Eurozone economy picks up despite virus disruption
articles.description: A survey shows that business activity in the 19-country eurozone has picked up in February from a deep slump, particularly in Germany's big industrial sector
articles.content:
LONDON -- 
Business in the 19-country eurozone has picked up in February from a deep slump, particularly in Germany's big industrial sector, despite disruption from the new coronavirus, a report showed Friday.

articles.title: South Korea reports 52 new cases of coronavirus, raising its total to 156, after declaring southern city a special zone
